# subfoldr2

`subfoldr2` is an R package to facilitate the saving and loading of

- R objects
- data frames (and tables)
- strings (and code blocks)
- numbers
- ggplot objects (and windows and png files)

and the opening and closing of

- graphics windows
- pdfs
- database (SQLite) connections

## Main Folder

By default files are saved to `output` unless overridden using
[`sbf_set_main()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_set_main.md)
which can take a relative or absolute path.

``` R
library(subfoldr2)
sbf_set_main(tempdir(), "output")
```

## Saving and Loading R Objects

### Single Objects

An R object can be written using
[`sbf_save_object()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_object.md)
and read using
[`sbf_load_object()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_object.md).

``` R
x <- 1
sbf_save_object(x)
sbf_load_object("x")
#> [1] 1
```

All R objects are saved as `.rds` files in folder `objects` (in the main
folder).

``` R
list.files(sbf_get_main(), recursive = TRUE)
#>  [1] "data/data2.rds"  "data/df.rds"     "numbers/x.csv"   "numbers/x.rds"   "numbers/x3.csv"  "numbers/x3.rds"  "objects/x.rds"  
#>  [8] "strings/chr.rda" "strings/chr.rds" "strings/chr.txt"
```

### Subfolders

The user can save objects to a particular sub folder within `objects`
using
[`sbf_set_sub()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_set_sub.md)
or the `sub = sbf_get_sub()` argument of
[`sbf_save_object()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_object.md).

``` R
sbf_set_sub("times2")
x <- x * 2
sbf_save_object(x)
sbf_save_object(x * 3, x_name = "x3", sub = "times2/times3")
sbf_save_object(data.frame(), x_name = "df", sub = "times2/times3")
list.files(sbf_get_main(), recursive = TRUE)
#>  [1] "data/data2.rds"               "data/df.rds"                  "numbers/x.csv"                "numbers/x.rds"               
#>  [5] "numbers/x3.csv"               "numbers/x3.rds"               "objects/times2/times3/df.rds" "objects/times2/times3/x3.rds"
#>  [9] "objects/times2/x.rds"         "objects/x.rds"                "strings/chr.rda"              "strings/chr.rds"             
#> [13] "strings/chr.txt"
```

### Loading Multiple Objects

The user can load all the objects in the current sub folder into the
calling environment using
[`sbf_load_objects()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_objects.md)
or recursively load all the objects as a list column in a data frame
using
[`sbf_load_objects_recursive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_objects_recursive.md).

``` R
print(sbf_set_sub("times2", "times3"))
#> [1] "times2/times3"
sbf_load_objects()
ls()
#> [1] "chr"   "data2" "df"    "vec"   "x"     "x3"
sbf_load_objects_recursive(sub = "times2")
#> # A tibble: 3 × 4
#>   objects      name  sub      file                                                                                           
#>   <list>       <chr> <chr>    <chr>                                                                                          
#> 1 <df [0 × 0]> df    "times3" /var/folders/yg/xzvpt0r53gsgj094f3sxb1n00000gn/T/RtmpwTf1sn/output/objects/times2/times3/df.rds
#> 2 <dbl [1]>    x3    "times3" /var/folders/yg/xzvpt0r53gsgj094f3sxb1n00000gn/T/RtmpwTf1sn/output/objects/times2/times3/x3.rds
#> 3 <dbl [1]>    x     ""       /var/folders/yg/xzvpt0r53gsgj094f3sxb1n00000gn/T/RtmpwTf1sn/output/objects/times2/x.rds
```

### Deleting Subfolders

To recursively delete a sub folder call
[`sbf_set_sub()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_set_sub.md)
with `rm = TRUE`.

``` R
sbf_set_sub("times2", rm = TRUE, ask = FALSE)
list.files(sbf_get_main(), recursive = TRUE)
#>  [1] "data/data2.rds"  "data/df.rds"     "numbers/x.csv"   "numbers/x.rds"   "numbers/x3.csv"  "numbers/x3.rds"  "objects/x.rds"  
#>  [8] "strings/chr.rda" "strings/chr.rds" "strings/chr.txt"
```

### Saving Multiple Objects

All the objects in the calling environment can be saved to the current
subdirectory using
[`sbf_save_objects()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_objects.md).

``` R
ls()
#> [1] "chr"   "data2" "df"    "vec"   "x"     "x3"
sbf_save_objects()
list.files(sbf_get_main(), recursive = TRUE)
#>  [1] "data/data2.rds"           "data/df.rds"              "numbers/x.csv"            "numbers/x.rds"           
#>  [5] "numbers/x3.csv"           "numbers/x3.rds"           "objects/times2/chr.rds"   "objects/times2/data2.rds"
#>  [9] "objects/times2/df.rds"    "objects/times2/vec.rds"   "objects/times2/x.rds"     "objects/times2/x3.rds"   
#> [13] "objects/x.rds"            "strings/chr.rda"          "strings/chr.rds"          "strings/chr.txt"
rm(x, x3, df)
sbf_load_objects()
print(x3)
#> [1] 6
print(df)
#> data frame with 0 columns and 0 rows
```

## Numbers, Strings and Data Frames

The above functions for saving and loading R objects are members of
families of functions for specific types of object. In particular there
are family members for

- numbers (numeric scalars)
- strings (character scalars)
- data (objects inheriting from data.frame)

``` R
sbf_reset_sub(rm = TRUE, ask = FALSE)
#> ✔ Directory '/var/folders/yg/xzvpt0r53gsgj094f3sxb1n00000gn/T/RtmpwTf1sn/output' deleted
data2 <- data.frame(x = 5:6, y = 7:8)
chr <- "some text"
vec <- c(1, 3) # not saved as vector
sbf_save_datas()
sbf_save_strings()
sbf_save_numbers()
list.files(sbf_get_main(), recursive = TRUE)
#> [1] "data/data2.rds"  "data/df.rds"     "numbers/x.csv"   "numbers/x.rds"   "numbers/x3.csv"  "numbers/x3.rds"  "strings/chr.rda"
#> [8] "strings/chr.rds" "strings/chr.txt"
```

All types of object are saved as rds files. However to facilitate
viewing, each number is also saved as a csv file and each string is also
saved as a txt file.

## Tables

Tables are data frames with just logical, numeric, character, factor,
Date and POSIXct columns. As tables are intended for reports they have
to be saved individually with an optional caption using
[`sbf_save_table()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_table.md).
As a result tables cannot be bulk saved however they can be bulked
loaded. Each table is also saved as csv file (to facilitate viewing) and
the metadata including the caption are saved as an rda file (to
facilitate report production).

To save a table which is not intended for a report set the argument
`report = FALSE`.

## Code Blocks

Code blocks are strings which include optional caption and language
metadata.

## Figures

### Plots

Plots are ggplot objects with caption, width and height (in inches) and
dpi (dots per inch) metadata. Each plot is also saved as a png file of
the specified dimensions and resolution and the default dataset if
present (and ≤ 1,000 rows) is saved as a csv. By default the last ggplot
object created, modified or plotted is saved and the dimensions are
taken from the current graphics device.

A platform independent graphics window can be opened using
[`sbf_open_window()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_open_window.md),
where the `width` and `height` arguments are in inches, and closed using
[`sbf_close_window()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_close_window.md).

In addition to individually or bulk loading ggplot objects, the user can
individually or bulk load the default datasets using for example
[`sbf_load_plots_data()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_plots_data.md).

### Windows

In the case of base or grid graphics the contents of the current window
can be copied to a png file (without an associated rds file) using
[`sbf_save_window()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_window.md)
which takes caption, width, height and dpi arguments. The window names
and file paths can be loaded using
[`sbf_load_windows_recursive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_windows_recursive.md).

If there are plots and windows with the same name then the duplicate
plot is dropped from the report.

### png Files

An existing png file can be imported into the windows subdirectories
using
[`sbf_save_png()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_png.md).

## Connections

## pdf Files

A pdf graphics device can be opened (in the current subfolder of the
pdfs folder) using
[`sbf_open_pdf()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_open_pdf.md)
and the current device can be closed using
[`sbf_close_pdf()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_close_pdf.md).
pdf graphics devices have the advantage of accepting multiple plots.
They are not incorporated into reports.

## Databases

A connection to a SQLite database (in the current subfolder of the dbs
folder) can be opened using `conn <- sbf_open_db()` and an individual
connection can be closed using `sbf_close_db(conn)`.

Alternatively,
[`sbf_save_datas_to_db()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_datas_to_db.md)
automatically open and closes the connection and uses
`readwritesqlite::rws_read_sqlite.environment` to write all the data
frames in the calling environment.

The opposite function,
[`sbf_load_datas_from_db()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_datas_from_db.md),
uses `rws_read_sqlite.SQLiteConnection` to save all the tables to the
calling environment.

## Report Generation

Reports can be generated using the
[subreport](https://github.com/poissonconsulting/subreport) package.

## Installation

To install the latest development version from GitHub
[repository](https://github.com/poissonconsulting/subfoldr2)

``` R
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("poissonconsulting/subfoldr2")
```

## Contribution

Please report any
[issues](https://github.com/poissonconsulting/subfoldr2/issues).

[Pull requests](https://github.com/poissonconsulting/subfoldr2/pulls)
are always welcome.

## Code of Conduct

Please note that the subfoldr2 project is released with a [Contributor
Code of
Conduct](https://contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.html).
By contributing to this project, you agree to abide by its terms

# Package index

## Save Items

- [`sbf_save_aws_files()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_aws_files.md)
  **\[deprecated\]** : Download files from AWS S3
- [`sbf_save_block()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_block.md)
  : Save Block
- [`sbf_save_data()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_data.md)
  : Save Data
- [`sbf_save_data_to_db()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_data_to_db.md)
  : Save Data Frame to Existing Database
- [`sbf_save_datas()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_datas.md)
  : Save Data Frames
- [`sbf_save_datas_to_db()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_datas_to_db.md)
  : Save Data Frames to Existing Database
- [`sbf_save_db_metatable_descriptions()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_db_metatable_descriptions.md)
  : Saves Meta Table Descriptions to Database
- [`sbf_save_db_to_workbook()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_db_to_workbook.md)
  : Save Database to Excel Workbook
- [`sbf_save_excel()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_excel.md)
  : Save Dataframe to Excel Workbook
- [`sbf_save_excels()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_excels.md)
  : Save Excels
- [`sbf_save_flobs_from_db()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_flobs_from_db.md)
  : Save flobs
- [`sbf_save_number()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_number.md)
  : Save Number
- [`sbf_save_numbers()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_numbers.md)
  : Save Numbers
- [`sbf_save_object()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_object.md)
  : Save Object
- [`sbf_save_objects()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_objects.md)
  : Save Objects
- [`sbf_save_plot()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_plot.md)
  : Save Plot
- [`sbf_save_png()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_png.md)
  : Save png File
- [`sbf_save_spatial()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_spatial.md)
  : Save Spatial Data
- [`sbf_save_spatials()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_spatials.md)
  : Save Spatial Data Frames
- [`sbf_save_string()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_string.md)
  : Save String
- [`sbf_save_strings()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_strings.md)
  : Save Strings
- [`sbf_save_table()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_table.md)
  : Save Table
- [`sbf_save_window()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_window.md)
  : Save Window
- [`sbf_save_workbook()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_workbook.md)
  : Save Dataframes to Excel Workbook
- [`sbf_save_data_to_pg()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_save_data_to_pg.md)
  **\[deprecated\]** : Add data frame to PostgreSQL database

## Load Items

- [`sbf_load_block()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_block.md)
  : Load Code Block
- [`sbf_load_blocks()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_blocks.md)
  : Load Blocks
- [`sbf_load_blocks_recursive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_blocks_recursive.md)
  : Load Blocks as Column in Data Frame
- [`sbf_load_data()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_data.md)
  : Load Data
- [`sbf_load_data_from_db()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_data_from_db.md)
  : Load Data Frame from Database
- [`sbf_load_datas()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_datas.md)
  : Load Datas
- [`sbf_load_datas_from_db()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_datas_from_db.md)
  : Load Data Frames from Database
- [`sbf_load_datas_recursive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_datas_recursive.md)
  : Load Data Frames as List Column in Data Frame
- [`sbf_load_db_metatable()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_db_metatable.md)
  : Load Data Frame of Meta Table from Database
- [`sbf_load_number()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_number.md)
  : Load Number
- [`sbf_load_numbers()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_numbers.md)
  : Load Numbers
- [`sbf_load_numbers_recursive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_numbers_recursive.md)
  : Load Numbers as Column in Data Frame
- [`sbf_load_object()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_object.md)
  : Load Object
- [`sbf_load_objects()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_objects.md)
  : Load Objects
- [`sbf_load_objects_recursive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_objects_recursive.md)
  : Load Objects as List Column in Data Frame
- [`sbf_load_plot()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_plot.md)
  : Load Plot
- [`sbf_load_plot_data()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_plot_data.md)
  : Load Plot Data
- [`sbf_load_plots_data()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_plots_data.md)
  : Load Plots Data
- [`sbf_load_plots_data_recursive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_plots_data_recursive.md)
  : Load Plots Data as List Column in Data Frame
- [`sbf_load_plots_recursive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_plots_recursive.md)
  : Load Plots as List Column in Data Frame
- [`sbf_load_spatial()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_spatial.md)
  : Load Spatial Data
- [`sbf_load_spatials()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_spatials.md)
  : Load Spatial Datas
- [`sbf_load_string()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_string.md)
  : Load String
- [`sbf_load_strings()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_strings.md)
  : Load Strings
- [`sbf_load_strings_recursive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_strings_recursive.md)
  : Load Strings as Column in Data Frame
- [`sbf_load_table()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_table.md)
  : Load Table
- [`sbf_load_tables()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_tables.md)
  : Load Tables
- [`sbf_load_tables_recursive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_tables_recursive.md)
  : Load Data Frames as List Column in Data Frame
- [`sbf_load_windows_recursive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_windows_recursive.md)
  : Load Window Paths as Character Column in Data Frame
- [`sbf_load_data_from_pg()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_data_from_pg.md)
  **\[deprecated\]** : Load a table from a PostgreSQL database
- [`sbf_load_datas_from_pg()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_load_datas_from_pg.md)
  **\[deprecated\]** : Load Data Frames from PostgreSQL Database

## Compare Items

- [`sbf_compare_data()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_compare_data.md)
  : Compare Data
- [`sbf_compare_data_archive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_compare_data_archive.md)
  : Compare Data Archive
- [`sbf_diff_data()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_diff_data.md)
  : Diff Data
- [`sbf_diff_data_archive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_diff_data_archive.md)
  : Diff Data Archive
- [`sbf_diff_table()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_diff_table.md)
  : Diff Table
- [`sbf_is_equal_data()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_is_equal_data.md)
  : Is Equal Data
- [`sbf_is_equal_data_archive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_is_equal_data_archive.md)
  : Is Equal Data Archive

## Directory Operations

- [`sbf_set_sub()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_set_sub.md)
  : Set Sub Folder
- [`sbf_reset_sub()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_reset_sub.md)
  : Reset Sub Folder
- [`sbf_get_sub()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_get_sub.md)
  : Get Sub Folder
- [`sbf_set_main()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_set_main.md)
  : Set Main
- [`sbf_reset_main()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_reset_main.md)
  : Reset Main
- [`sbf_get_main()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_get_main.md)
  : Get Main
- [`sbf_set_db_name()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_set_db_name.md)
  : Set Database Name
- [`sbf_reset_db_name()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_reset_db_name.md)
  : Reset Database Name
- [`sbf_get_db_name()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_get_db_name.md)
  : Get Database Name
- [`sbf_reset()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_reset.md)
  : Reset Main, Sub and Database Name
- [`sbf_up_sub()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_up_sub.md)
  : Move Up Sub Folder
- [`sbf_add_sub()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_add_sub.md)
  : Add Sub Folder
- [`sbf_get_archive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_get_archive.md)
  : Get Archive Directory
- [`sbf_get_workbook_name()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_get_workbook_name.md)
  : Get Workbook Name

## SQLite Database Operations

- [`sbf_open_db()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_open_db.md)
  : Open SQLite Database Connection
- [`sbf_close_db()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_close_db.md)
  : Close Database Connection
- [`sbf_copy_db()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_copy_db.md)
  : Copy SQLite Database
- [`sbf_query_db()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_query_db.md)
  : Query Existing Database
- [`sbf_create_db()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_create_db.md)
  : Create SQLite Database
- [`sbf_execute_db()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_execute_db.md)
  : Execute SQL Statement on Existing Database
- [`sbf_upload_flobs_to_db()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_upload_flobs_to_db.md)
  : Upload flobs
- [`sbf_add_blob_column_to_db()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_add_blob_column_to_db.md)
  : Add blob column

## PostgreSQL Database Operations

- [`sbf_open_pg()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_open_pg.md)
  **\[deprecated\]** : Open PostgreSQL Connection
- [`sbf_close_pg()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_close_pg.md)
  **\[deprecated\]** : Close PostgreSQL Connection
- [`sbf_backup_pg()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_backup_pg.md)
  **\[deprecated\]** : Save PostgreSQL backup
- [`sbf_create_pg()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_create_pg.md)
  **\[deprecated\]** : Create PostgreSQL database
- [`sbf_execute_pg()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_execute_pg.md)
  **\[deprecated\]** : Execute SQL statement for PostgreSQL database
- [`sbf_list_tables_pg()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_list_tables_pg.md)
  **\[deprecated\]** : List tables in a schema
- [`sbf_set_schema()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_set_schema.md)
  **\[deprecated\]** : Set Schema Name
- [`sbf_get_schema()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_get_schema.md)
  **\[deprecated\]** : Get Schema Name
- [`sbf_reset_schema()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_reset_schema.md)
  **\[deprecated\]** : Reset Schema Name
- [`sbf_set_config_file()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_set_config_file.md)
  **\[deprecated\]** : Set the Config File path
- [`sbf_get_config_file()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_get_config_file.md)
  **\[deprecated\]** : Get the Config File Path
- [`sbf_reset_config_file()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_reset_config_file.md)
  **\[deprecated\]** : Reset the Config File Path
- [`sbf_set_config_value()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_set_config_value.md)
  **\[deprecated\]** : Set the Config Value
- [`sbf_get_config_value()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_get_config_value.md)
  **\[deprecated\]** : Get the Config File Value
- [`sbf_reset_config_value()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_reset_config_value.md)
  **\[deprecated\]** : Reset the Config File Value

## Housekeeping

- [`sbf_archive_main()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_archive_main.md)
  : Archive Main Folder
- [`sbf_unarchive_main()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_unarchive_main.md)
  : Unarchive Main Folder
- [`sbf_rm_main()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_rm_main.md)
  : Remove Main
- [`sbf_rm_flobs()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_rm_flobs.md)
  : Delete Flobs Subdfolder

## Graphic Operations

- [`sbf_open_pdf()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_open_pdf.md)
  : Open PDF Device
- [`sbf_close_pdf()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_close_pdf.md)
  : Close PDF Device
- [`sbf_open_window()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_open_window.md)
  : Open Graphics Window
- [`sbf_close_window()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_close_window.md)
  : Close Window
- [`sbf_close_windows()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_close_windows.md)
  : Close Windows

## Path to Items

- [`sbf_path_block()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_path_block.md)

- [`sbf_path_data()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_path_data.md)
  : Path to Data

  : Path to Database
- [`sbf_path_number()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_path_number.md)
  : Path to Number
- [`sbf_path_object()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_path_object.md)
  : Path to Object
- [`sbf_path_plot()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_path_plot.md)
  : Path to Plot
- [`sbf_path_string()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_path_string.md)
  : Path to String
- [`sbf_path_table()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_path_table.md)
  : Path to Table
- [`sbf_path_window()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_path_window.md)
  : Path to Window

## List Items File Paths

- [`sbf_list_blocks()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_list_blocks.md)
  : Gets List of Block Files as a Character Vector
- [`sbf_list_datas()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_list_datas.md)
  : Gets List of Data Files as a Character Vector
- [`sbf_list_dbs()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_list_dbs.md)
  : Gets List of Database Files as a Character Vector
- [`sbf_list_numbers()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_list_numbers.md)
  : Gets List of Number Files as a Character Vector
- [`sbf_list_objects()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_list_objects.md)
  : Gets List of Object Files as a Character Vector
- [`sbf_list_plots()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_list_plots.md)
  : Gets List of Plot Files as a Character Vector
- [`sbf_list_strings()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_list_strings.md)
  : Gets List of String Files as a Character Vector
- [`sbf_list_tables()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_list_tables.md)
  : Gets List of Data Files as a Character Vector
- [`sbf_list_windows()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_list_windows.md)
  : Gets List of Window Files as a Character Vector

- [`sbf_block_exists()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_block_exists.md)
  : Code Block Exists
- [`sbf_data_exists()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_data_exists.md)
  : Data Exists
- [`sbf_number_exists()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_number_exists.md)
  : Number Exists
- [`sbf_object_exists()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_object_exists.md)
  : Object Exists
- [`sbf_plot_exists()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_plot_exists.md)
  : Plot Exists
- [`sbf_string_exists()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_string_exists.md)
  : String Exists
- [`sbf_table_exists()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_table_exists.md)
  : Table Exists

## Getting Subs (removing )

- [`sbf_subs_block_recursive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_subs_block_recursive.md)
  : Gets Subs of a Block as a Character Vector
- [`sbf_subs_data_recursive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_subs_data_recursive.md)
  : Gets Subs of a Data Frame as a Character Vector
- [`sbf_subs_number_recursive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_subs_number_recursive.md)
  : Gets Subs of a Number as a Character Vector
- [`sbf_subs_object_recursive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_subs_object_recursive.md)
  : Gets Subs of an Object as a Character Vector
- [`sbf_subs_plot_recursive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_subs_plot_recursive.md)
  : Gets Subs of a Plot as a Character Vector
- [`sbf_subs_string_recursive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_subs_string_recursive.md)
  : Gets Subs of a String as a Character Vector
- [`sbf_subs_table_recursive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_subs_table_recursive.md)
  : Gets Subs of a Table as a Character Vector
- [`sbf_subs_window_recursive()`](https://poissonconsulting.github.io/subfoldr2/reference/sbf_subs_window_recursive.md)
  : Gets Subs of a Window as a Character Vector
